title: How to Make Greek Vinaigrette

methods.name: Mixing Up a Basic Greek Vinaigrette

steps.headline: Combine all of the ingredients in a jar.
steps.description: Add ¼ cup (44 ml) of extra virgin olive oil, 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of red wine vinegar, the juice from 1 lemon, 2 garlic cloves that have been smashed and peeled, 1 teaspoon (2 g) of dried oregano leaves, 3 pinches of salt, and 10 to 15 grinds of fresh black pepper to a jar or other container with a lid. Put the lid on the container, and shake vigorously to mix the dressing. If you don't have garlic cloves, you can substitute ¼ teaspoon (1 g) of garlic powder.

steps.headline: Taste the dressing and season if necessary.
steps.description: After the dressing is well mixed, remove the lid from the jar. Give the vinaigrette a taste, and add more salt and pepper if you think it's necessary. If you feel like your dressing doesn't have a strong enough garlic taste, don't worry. The garlic flavor becomes stronger the longer that it sits. However, if you plan to use the dressing right after mixing it, you may want to mince or press the cloves instead of smashing them.

steps.headline: Store the dressing in the refrigerator.
steps.description: When you're happy with the seasoning of the vinaigrette, put the lid back on the jar. Place it in the refrigerator, and use it within a week. The ingredients tend to separate as the dressing sits, so be sure to stir or shake it before using it.

methods.name: Preparing a Greek Vinaigrette with Mustard

steps.headline: Mix all of the ingredients in a blender.
steps.description: Add ¾ cup (177 ml) of extra virgin olive oil, 1 cup (240 ml) of red wine vinegar, 2 teaspoons (6 g) of garlic powder, 2 teaspoons (4 g) of dried oregano, 2 teaspoons (4 g) of dried basil, 1 ½ teaspoons (3 g) of black pepper, 1 teaspoon (6 g) of salt, 1 ½ teaspoons (5 g) of onion powder, 2 teaspoons (10 g) of dijon style mustard, and the juice from ½ a lemon to the pitcher of a blender. Secure the lid on the pitcher. If you don't have a blender, you can combine the ingredients in a bowl and whisk them together. You can also add them to a jar with a lid and shake to combine them.

steps.headline: Process the dressing.
steps.description: Once all of the ingredients are in the pitcher, turn the blender on. Blend the ingredients for 30 seconds to 1 minute, or until the vinaigrette is fully mixed. The finished dressing should have an opaque yellowish tan color.

steps.headline: Place the dressing in the refrigerator until you're ready to use.
steps.description: When you're finished blending the vinaigrette, pour it into a lidded jar or other covered container. Store in the refrigerator for use within a week. The vinaigrette can sometimes thicken when it's refrigerated. To thin it out, let it sit for 15 to 20 minutes at room temperature or warm it in the microwave for 15 seconds.

methods.name: Whipping Up a Low-Fat Greek Vinaigrette

steps.headline: Combine all of the ingredients.
steps.description: Add 4 tablespoons (60 ml) of fresh lemon juice, 4 tablespoons (60 ml) of red wine vinegar, 1 teaspoon (2 g) of dried oregano, ¼ teaspoon (½ g) of black pepper, 1 garlic clove, ¼ cup (44 ml) of extra virgin olive oil, and ¼ cup (44 ml) of fat-free chicken broth to a large bowl. Use a whisk to thoroughly blend all of the ingredients together. If you don't have any fresh garlic, substitute ⅛ teaspoon (.3 g) of garlic powder.

steps.headline: Allow the mixture to sit.
steps.description: After you've mixed all of the ingredients together, it's important to give the flavors time to meld. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, and let the vinaigrette sit for 1 to 2 hours to get the most flavorful dressing.

steps.headline: Refrigerate the dressing for storage.
steps.description: If you don't plan to use the vinaigrette right away, transfer it to a glass jar or bottle with a lid. Store the dressing in the refrigerator, and use it up within a week. If the dressing thickens up at all after it's refrigerated, stir or shake it before use.
